album.title: All That You Can't Leave Behind

wiki.content:
"Walk On" is the fourth single from U2's 2000 album, All That You Can't Leave Behind. The song was written about Aung San Suu Kyi. It won the "Grammy Award for Record of the Year" in 2002, marking the first time an artist had won the award for songs from the same album in consecutive years.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Walk On" is the fourth single from U2's 2000 album, All That You Can't Leave Behind. The song was written about Aung San Suu Kyi. It won the "Grammy Award for Record of the Year" in 2002, marking the first time an artist had won the award for songs from the same album in consecutive years.

track.name: Walk On
comments: Aung San Suu Kyi - free at last
All that you fashion, all that you make, all that you build, all that you break, all that you measure, all that you feel, all this you can't leave behind.
One of my favorite songs of all time.
i love the ending of this song
Sad to see a glass heart.

http://rockestra-edu.blogspot.com.br/2012/03/u218-singles-2006.html U218 Singles foi lançado em novembro de 2006 e é um pequeno resumo da brilhante trajetória da banda irlandesa.O cd contém 16 dos mais populares singles do U2 além das inéditas
oh no be strong walk on
The ending always remind me of "Eclipse".
It rather saddens me to learn that when people listen to this song, they think not of Aung San Suu Kyi, the amazing woman for whom and about whom it was written, but of the last episode of Friends...
10 years on, I've just realised how much I love this song. I teared up toward the end, it's really very good.
I have not heard this song in years.  I forgot how much I loved it :) ♥
